was discharged through a spectral tube 
enclosing hydrogen which was gradaly 
rarefied to the highest tensity[?], to be 
reached at by means of Geissler’s Ex 
hauster, finally the beautiful red colour 
of the ignited gas became fainter and 
passed gradually into an undetermined 
violet. When analysed by the prism H[alpha]
disappeared, while H[beta], though fainter 
remained well defined. Accordingly 
light, of a greater length of wave, was 
the first extinguisched. +
+ Plucker. Uber recurrente Strome 
und ihre Benutzung[?] zur Darstellung 
von Gasspectren. Pogg. Ann. CXVI
p 51
Plucker. Ueber recurrente 
Strome und ihre Anwendung 
zur Darstellung von Gas-
spectren. Pogg. Ann. CXVI p.51
58. Hydrogen shows in the most striking way 
the expansion of its spectral lines and 
their gradual transformation into a 
continuous spectrum. When the direct 
discharges of Ruhmkorff’s large induction 
coil is sent through the old spectrum 
tubes, enclosing hydrogen, the formerly 
obtained spectrum is essentially altered.
By increasing the power of the coil the 
violet line H[gamma] first expands, while it conti 
nues to expand the expansion of the bluish 
green line H[beta] becomes visible. Let the apper 
ture of the slit be regulated so, that the 
double sodium-line will separate into two 
single lines, nearly touching one another. Thus
the angular breadth of H[beta] becoming 2 or 
3 minutes, the breadth of H[gamma] is about 
the double. The expa[n]sion takes place as well 
towards the less as toward the more refracte[d]
part of the spectrum. H[alpha] remains al<s>l<\s>most 
unchanged after H[gamma] passed into an undeter
